quote.text: Listen to many, speak to a few.
quote.author: William Shakespeare

quote.text: The love of heaven makes one heavenly.
quote.author: William Shakespeare

quote.text: When words are scarce they are seldom spent in vain.
quote.author: William Shakespeare

quote.text: I hold the world but as the world, Gratiano; A stage where every man must play a part, And mine is a sad one.
quote.author: William Shakespeare

quote.text: Teach not thy lip such scorn, for it was made For kissing, lady, not for such contempt.
quote.author: William Shakespeare

quote.text: Tis best to weigh the enemy more mighty than he seems.
quote.author: William Shakespeare

quote.text: And oftentimes excusing of a fault doth make the fault the worse by the excuse.
quote.author: William Shakespeare

quote.text: There is a tide in the affairs of men, Which taken at the flood, leads on to fortune. Omitted, all the voyage of their life is bound in shallows and in miseries. On such a full sea are we now afloat. And we must take the current when it serves, or lose our ventures.
quote.author: William Shakespeare

quote.text: Wisely, and slow. They stumble that run fast.
quote.author: William Shakespeare

quote.text: Pleasure and action make the hours seem short.
quote.author: William Shakespeare

quote.text: Who could refrain that had a heart to love and in that heart courage to make love known?
quote.author: William Shakespeare

quote.text: â€œSay as you think and speak it from your souls.
quote.author: William Shakespeare

quote.text: A friend is one that knows you as you are, understands where you have been, accepts what you have become, and still, gently allows you to grow.
quote.author: William Shakespeare
